means: 匆忙记下( jot的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: All the time I was talking he was jotting down.
sentence.Network_cn: 每次我在讲话时,他就会记录下来.

sentence.Network_en: The student considers jotting down the number of the businessman's American Express card.
sentence.Network_cn: 这论理学生打算快迅速地记录下来下这位商贾的美国运通卡的金额.

sentence.Network_en: As they talked, two secretaries sat behind them and took notes, jotting down everything they said.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他们谈话的时候, 两上秘书坐在后面做笔记, 把他们所说的话全部记录下来.

后部墨水 Background Job后部工作 background jot后部工作
He jotted down the conceits of his idle hours ., 他记下了闲暇时想到的一些看法.

entry.def: Jottings are brief, informal notes that you write down.

auth_sentence.content: He adjusted the recipe, jotting down numbers in a notebook.
auth_sentence.res_content: He adjusted the recipe, jotting down numbers in a notebook.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He adjusted the recipe, jotting down numbers in a notebook.

auth_sentence.content: Jotting down each dull footstep with a melancholy dub of his staff.

auth_sentence.content: Taxpayers often make the mistake of simply jotting down a sentence fragment like, to correct my mortgage interest deduction.
